item.title: Roll Abilities
item.description: The first step in character creation is determining Ability scores. You can either roll random scores, or you can randomly assign a standard set of scores. To roll for random Ability scores, follow these two easy steps: Roll 3d6 six times, assigning each result to an Ability in the following order: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma. If the total of the six scores is less than 62, scrap the character and start over.
